Clinical: Deafness. Diarrhoea (night). Dropsy. Epilepsy. Gout. Headache. Heartburn. Hiccough. Hysteria. Menstruation, disorders of. Oesophagus, stricture of. Paralysis. Rheumatism. Tongue, affections of; swelling of. Toothache. Urinary disorders. Vertigo.
Characteristics: Cajutut has a reputation in the old school as a local application in rheumatism, and also in cases of dysmenorrhoea. It has had a homoeopathic proving, and some very characteristic symptoms have been developed. A feeling of enlargement; too large all over; as if head as large as half a bushel. Feeling as though could not get himself together (Bapt.); could not get his clothes for a time, though they were quite near. As if poisoned. As if the arms were tied to the body; heavy; useless. Numb feeling all over. A measles-like eruption; intense itching. Many nervous symptoms are developed, some reflected from the female sexual organs. There is the persistent choking sensation of hysteria; nervous dyspnoea; nervous distension of the bowels. Earache and faceache; the lobe of the ear is red; alae nasi suddenly turn red; nose appears swollen. It has cured obstinate hiccough from slightest provocation, talking, laughing, eating, or any motion. Symptoms appear and disappear suddenly; come at a.m.; disappear suddenly on eating. Many symptoms are < at night. Smoking = desire to vomit.
Relations: Compare: Bov. (swollen sensations); Plantago (earache, toothache); Colch. (gout and rheumatism); Aco. and Bell. (effects of checked sweat). Eucalyptus, Eugenia caryophyllacea (clove), Eugenia jambos and the Brazil-nut tree belong to the same order.
Mind: Averse to being spoken to, though likes to hear other people talk.
Can't bear to look inside the books he usually studies; can think of a thousand things in a minute.
Feels better in the society of ladies, and can talk with them (though naturally bashful); he does not like to talk with the men.
Head: Intoxicated feeling, feels as if he would stumble over his own legs.
Head feels enlarged; dull and heavy; in occiput.
Frontal headache, esp. in eyes, < on bending forward.
Severe headache a.m., with prosopalgia and stiffness of jaws.
Eyes: Heavy feeling in eyes; upper lids feel as heavy and thick as leather.
Nose: During day alae nasi suddenly turn red, redness suddenly disappearing.
Nose is most prominent; looks as if large and extending out from face on looking down.
Face: Cannot hurt skin of face by pinching it.
Stiff, dry feeling in jaws, with neuralgic pains in malar bones, and severe headache all over head on waking at a.m.
Mouth: Tongue feels swollen; as if it filled mouth all up, making her lisp, feels scalded; looks white and rough.
Throat: Constant inclination to spit and hawk up large quantities of tough white mucus, which he could feel drawn through the nares.
Oesophagus: paralysed; swollen sensation; constricted, <, attempting to swallow solid food.
Stomach: Burning in throat down to stomach.
Stool and Rectum: Choleraic diarrhoea from sudden check of perspiration.
Urinary Organs: Urine diminished, milky; smells like cat's urine.
Male Sexual Organs: Erections all night, and long after rising, but without the least desire.
Female Sexual Organs: Menses suspended, or diminished and attended with pain, when caused by a cold or check of perspiration.
Respiratory Organs: Sharp pain through apices of both lungs from before backward (esp. r.).
Neck: All the muscles of the neck are very sensitive to pressure.
Limbs: Rheumatic symptoms (Cajuput oil is a common remedy as an application to rheumatic joints).
Pain as if joints were enlarged.
Upper Limbs: Arms feel like soaked wood hanging to one.
Left arm feels out of joint.
Lower Limbs: Stitching pains in knees on rising in bed.
